channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Horrible potholes x2 just after traffic island, 30th April
item.description:
Heading north into Cheltenham on A435 Cirencester Road after Lilley Brook Golf Club and just after traffic island where you transition from 40MPH limit to 30MPH limit you encounter x2 potholes which hit both sides of your car and you cannot avoid them since you are constrained by the traffic island. Frankly the road surface is breaking up.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 305, Cirencester Road, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lane guidance unclear/not followed by drivers, 30th April
item.description:
When I come from the Churchdown Road onto the roundabout to go to A40 (golden valley) the markings ON the roundabout say left hand and middle lane go towards B&Q and only the right lane goes round to A40. However, daily people turn right from the middle lane into the middle lane exit onto GV preventing me from safely exiting when they are in the wrong. I’m surprised there hasn’t been an accident because it seems a “Wild West”/just make it work roundabout at the moment.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Arle Court Roundabout, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.title: Bad phasing is causing light and queue jumpers. Two incidents witnessed today., 30th April
item.description:
Location: Traffic lights at junction of SafeStore and service road to kings ditch. Lights are spending most time on green for the Safestore entry to junction. People NOT at the front of the queue (from both directions) have been observed leaving queue, overtaking queue, jumping lights (any colour). From North I observed a car using the WRONG side of the island. This is an accident waiting to happen.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kingsditch Lane, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: The traffic light has been vandalised

item.title: Pavement is worn away and broken up, 30th April
item.description:
The LH pavement is almost gone and is basically an uneven muddy track between the junction with Old Bath Road and 2a Everest Road. The verge is also overgrown and needs clearing, levelling and turfing. The pavement outside 2a Everest Road is an uneven patchwork of poor repairs.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: No pavements, 30th April
item.description:
The Developer has no permission to dig up a public pavements affecting the 50 + people that live in St Stephens roads flats some with mobility issues. B E Rudman (01242 255043/ 07843277723) said he has permission ( G M Buliders 01242 254291/07850335883 ). This is not true as when another neighbour tried to do the same your organisation stated only specific contractors would be used on your 'approved list'. The developers have damaged the pavements across all 5 neighbours so either get the permissions, give notice close the road and repair all the damage or leave alone. My elderly neighbours can cope with most things if given appropriate notice and things are done as they should be.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Hatherley Street, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Tall hedges and trees, 30th April
item.description:
The hedges and trees are located on the cheltenham Rd Cross Rd with two hedges bishops cleeve. They were cut about 5 yrs ago to ground level and now very high and I think they could be damaging my boundary wall. I contacted tewksbury Borough Council thinking it was there land but they have told me it doesn't belong to them.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet
